job_title: Enrollment Analyst in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The best thing I can say about Express Scripts is the benefits.
cons: There was no organization in the department I worked in. There was a lack of training. You were thrown into a position and had to figure things out as you go. A training manual was thrown together as the last minute for new employees, but it did not cover everything you had to know in order to do the job successfully.  The department was under staffed. In order to stay on top of your work load, you had to take work at home a few more hours in addition to the long work day you put in at Express Scripts. I feel there was also a lack of leadership in the department I worked in. There are too many computer systems you had to use to research the clients information. This was the worst job I ever had.

job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Port Saint Lucie, FL
pros: There are sufficient vending machines for snacks.
cons: If you want to keep your job, do not, whatever you do, comment about the pro homosexual agenda of ESI!!!!!  You will be punished for commenting about the FILTHY attitude of ESI!!!!  Even if the reader of this post is pro gay, consider this:  if you work past 9:30 P.M., you will hear a LOUD vacuum being run right past you desk WHILE YOU ARE ON A CALL!!!!!  corporate emailed me a document which I would have submitted to my doctor had I sill worked for ESI which would have required me to schedule my extra restroom breaks.  How in God's name do I now when I need to go to the bathroom before I start my shift?!?!?  Thank God I do not work there anymore!!!!!!!!!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
- The benefits were okay
- Some of the people I worked with were fantastic
- I had one awesome boss
cons:
- Very little work-life balance (work was 60 - 70 hours a week)
- Expectations were, at times, outrageous
- Very little reward for very hard work
- Not very open with their employees. They tended to treat everyone like a threat, rather than an asset
- Several more issues, but as a professional, I will not divulge them here

review_title: There are no advancement opportunities, policies, procedures are conflicting and cause people to burn out and get sick.
pros: paycheck, insurance, other than that, if people could work somewhere else they would
cons: People are getting sick from constant required overtime and stress caused by the job.  All the new hires make mistakes and people are not getting their meds, And then "we" have to apologize constantly if not you will get a bad quality. Adherences and Attendance points are unfair.  If you leave in an ambulance, be sure you will be assessed .33 against you.  They don't care about you only MONEY

review_title: They bought my former employer (Medco), and drove them into the ditch!
pros: The work life balance was good. I rarely had to take work home with me. The pay was appropriate, and I do like the PTO bank as opposed to separate days for sick / personal, etc.
cons: If you work out of the Franklin Lakes New Jersey facility, there is a good chance you could finish your entire career without ever feeling safe in your job. The layoffs have been stretched out over a period of years and show no signs of abating. They also LOVE to micro-manage.

job_title: Header Entry-CphT In Training in Albuquerque, NM
pros: Learning new skills but after obtain CpHT there is no raise.
cons: I cannot make it on $11.03 hr as the primary wage earner in family.

review_title: Don't stay in customer service too long
job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Dublin, OH
pros: Weekly pay, there is not really anything else. You'll first think you will love it until you've been on the floor for about 1-2 months.
cons: Everything, the systems are terrible your limited on what you can do but the give you the responsibility of doing a lot. This was the most segregated place I've ever worked at. The management is unhelpful, and anything else you can think of negative at a work environment, it's happening at express scripts.

job_title: Member Service Representative in Charlotte, NC
pros: The company doesn't require that you be over "sugary" will members when they call in.  For example, you don't have to ask permission to ask them a question.  The company also recognizes your achievements and commitment to providing excellent service.
cons: I was work-at-home in North Carolina and sometimes had problems getting a supervisor to pick up when I had to escalate a call.   The members would get irritated having to wait so long to get help.  Also, training for dealing with open season calls was inadequate.  Oftentimes I could not find prescription benefit info on plans that had not gone into effect yet.

job_title: Senior Technical Writer in Memphis, TN
pros:
Pay was average
Some management from Medco still work for this company and are generally good people
Location was easy to get to
cons: Total focus was on increasing profits by cutting back on service to customers. Company designed policies and procedures to make it difficult for complaining customers to get help with orders, which were often mishandled. Insurance companies and pharmaceutical companies were dropping ES because their customers preferred doing business with more reputable companies.  I was laid off and denied unemployment benefits. Company harassed me about signing an agreement not to sue them. I reported them to the state department of labor. Very shady company.

pros: Great 401k; Great Tuition Plan!
cons: low pay; leadership totally unprofessional & manipulate your pto so at the end of the day you think you have time to spend with your family but not so because your PTO disappeared -no work life balance- work 6 days -off one-work week-ends//Training sucks- trainers trying to teach you and it's obvious that they haven't studied the lesson themselves! How can you teach what U do it know? How can U share where U Do Not Go? ESI only pays $12.00 an hour-been here over a year-no raises--their stock is over $80.00 per share so why do they not pay the worker bees?? because they are "GREEDY & DON'T CARE"- how can we pay our bills & take care of our Kids??? It's just WRONG!

review_title: You can grow quickly but don't expect to retire on your paycheck
job_title: Business Analyst in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great exposure to PBM with countless opportunities to switch career paths.  My Leadership is exception and sets a good example of how to be a good boss.
cons: chaotic information and reporting throughout the company.  Communication between departments, within departments and up to leadership needs much improvement.

review_title: Small company learning to be big
pros: I'm new to Express Scripts, having been part of Medco Health when they were purchased in 4/2012. There does appear to be a good amount of due diligence as resources are being integrated. The staff is all quite nice, and their new-ish digs in St. Louis are bright and shiny.
cons: Disclaimer - see opening sentence of my pros... Communication up and down the silos is poor - there is plenty of happy, glossy info distributed, but it's not relevant to what's happening on the ground. The management team seems to be happy that they've purchased market share, but they don't seem to know what to do with it.  And paranoid? If they can't see exactly what you're doing all the time, they seem to assume that you're not working.

job_title: Data Entry Pharmacy Technician in Mason, OH
pros: They do ofter extensive training for all of the tasks they have you do
cons:
Has the lowest pay scale for the positions doing the same job in the area. Every mail order pharmacy in the area pays at least 2 dollars more an hour.

Management has their own cliques and will blatantly ignore your needs as your production rate slips into the toilet, while they sit and gab with their "friends" on the floor doing the same job as you. Then come back and complain about your numbers while their pet puppet friends walk around away from their desk just gabbing away not getting work done and nothing is done about it.

pros: My boss is excellent, great flexibility, casual work environment.
cons: Total politics in the company. Constant upper management changes which leaves employees feeling like there is lack of direction. Lots of great ideas, hardly any execution. Many people in management that are not qualified to be there. Hard to find competent people to work with, most aren't willing to take ownership of work and run with it. Company cares too much about cutting cost no matter the consequences (decreases morale).

pros: None. Zero. Zilch. There are no pros to working at Express Scripts.
cons:
Wall Street shared the worst company to work for. The worst one is:
1. Express Scripts (NASDAQ: ESRX)
> Rating: 2.3
> Number of reviews: 1,100
> CEO approval rating: 28%
> Employees: 30,000
> Industry: Retail – Drug Stores & Proprietary Stores

While pharmacy chain CVS Health received poor employees ratings, it still fared better than Express Scripts, which was the only large company to receive an average rating of 2.3 on Glassdoor. Just 28% of the current and former Express Scripts employees surveyed said they would recommend working at the pharmacy benefit management company to a friend. Only one other company, Forever 21, had such a poor recommendation rate. Employees at Express Scripts had a variety of complaints, but the most common ones included being rushed at work or having far too much work. Many employees reported they were constantly afraid of being fired or having their branch shut down.

pros: Depends on your role..For me, I am in an advisory role with minimal day to day interaction with the business.  ESI is making a effort to improve employee satisfaction and it's beginning to show.  They have gone through some major growing pains making things work after all the mergers/acquisitions.  Hours are fine for me but there are some that work 60+ to keep afloat.  Depends on your role
cons: Huge emphasis on uptime which is great but makes getting things done a bit more difficult.  Teams are spread around the country and world which can make for some additional barriers.  Very metric based environment which is fine but takes away from the real work that needs to be done.

job_title: Senior Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: ES is a great place to work. It’s a dynamic company with very good benefits and significant opportunities for learning and career growth. The culture has shifted toward a greater focus on employees. Employee resource groups help build communities within a large organization while providing opportunities for networking, mentoring, and collaboration. Promotion from within is typical, and many of my colleagues have been with the organization for several years. I appreciate working for a healthcare company that makes a difference in people’s lives.
cons: It can take time to learn the business and workloads can be a challenge. Also, too often assertiveness is rewarded over collaboration.

pros: There is the occasional opportunity for overtime and if we're not a phone technician you can listen to music while working
cons: The production quotas are very high and unreasonable when trying to keep patient safety in mind, the work instructions change constantly and occasionally drastically, along with OT the employees are subject to" voluntary time off" if there is not enough work, and while they say they want to hear your ideas for improvement most of the time those ideas are ignored, they identify themselves as a "healthcare company" yet take little to no steps to help keep their employees healthy

review_title: I learned a lot working on the specialty side Accredo.
job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Orlando, FL
pros: Great co workers, weekly events (ex comfy day, snack day, March of dimes) we had a cafe on site and friendly supervisors.
cons: High turn over, no work/life balance, back to back calls and constant change. They care more about numbers than patients, medicine and employees. Instead of being a huge team, it is everyone against everyone (ex: supervisor ratings and rankings, a bunch of dedicated teams, team rating and rankings) there's no real unity within Accredo. Systems, policies and work changes on a almost month to month basis.

pros: good pay,  educational opportunity, good benefits, including helping with education,
cons: does not really like competitive employees just to stick with the status quo. Diversity stops the further up the chain of hierarchy. No true growth unless you are in the "club" . Culture is run by fear and not true value in the employee. Money is everything to the organization , synergy, but not to your pay check , layoff. No true work life balance. Senior management  captures nepotism. That's how it works... accept or move on.  take this as a grain of salt as you may enjoy this type of environment and actually do have a different perspective. Still love the business model and what Express Scripts is doing ... just the culture is not for true people persons and who thrive on true competition without all the gimmicks

pros: Not recommended. This place is for only nerdy greedy and servant mind people . Not place for intelligent independent mind . Only pros is if you need job and keep your mouth shut then this place is for you .
cons: Positioned leaders at time does some good people pushers work . They are in the job because they are able kiss up and manage more private secretary  work the leadership work . Bonus is alluring that keeps the job and people going .

pros: I can still work from home & I still get a paycheck.
cons: It's hard to put into words how demoralizing this place has become.  There has really been no effort at integrating teams or making sure the right person is in the right role.  Every time there is a challenge or something goes wrong, it's because of "Medco", yet it's the Medco systems that are being used, so maybe they need to consider that they're letting the wrong people go.  The work-life balance is horrendous.  So far I've worked 5 out of the last 6 weekends and I have to work New Years Day.  I'm expecting them to tell me any minute that I need to work Christmas.

review_title: Don't buy the fake 5 star reviews.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Good PTO policy.  Coworkers are good.
cons: Pay is not competitive. No upward mobility.  Management eliminates good jobs when people leave and delegates their duties to remaining employees, or hires a temp.  People are leaving because they are stck in dead end jobs.  They are overworked.

pros: Insurance and great co workers
cons: They violate many federal employment laws and refuse to comply with violations and judgements found against them this is all public and can be looked up and verified. The pay is very low and not much chance for advancement . The morale of the employees is very low since express scripts took over from medco they spent tons of money on a new gym and updating  the office instead of increasing pay so there is a high turnover rate because of low pay.  Patients are often very upset because of how difficult it is to get medications out to them due to company issues. Very stressful and not worth the lack of pay to deal with the supervisors determine who gets the highest raises they are only allowed so many at a certain percentage so lots of brown nosing they may only be able to give 3 people the top raise on each team. Dont waiste your time with this company they only care about themselves

pros:
Work/Life Balance
There are some very talented people
cons:
Pay is below industry average for IT
Management and leadership are blind, refuse to work with each other/communicate
Lots of higher ups have political agendas, don't really care about the client/end user and only focused on big projects that give them visibility resulting in overlap or duplication of efforts
Lots of copy paste of mediocre/crap code
Stack ranking-management refuses to acknowledge it but only 1-2 people under a team are going to get that promotion no matter how well you do
Directors and above really like to throw people under the bus
Lack of collaboration/innovation--they vouch for such a culture but rarely practice it. Instead of promoting each other, lots of teams do not embrace it.
Frat boy culture - beware, especially if you are a female in IT. Definitely seen some sexual harassment borderline lawsuits occur.

review_title: I enjoyed working with Express Scripts until they became so large and lost site of its members needs.
pros: I feel the company offered competitive salary and benefits, immediate management was supportive and easy to work with.  I enjoyed providing service to the patients/members.  I felt the job was rewarding when I left for the day I felt as if I helped our members.  Our office teams worked well together.
cons: While the company offered competitive salaries, they closed office in areas that were at a higher cost of living and moved to other locations (states) to be able to provide lower salaries to new employees.  I heard the company asked employees to take pay cuts or freezes due to the economy however Express Scripts does not appear to have suffered with the current economy status.  The company has even outsourced overseas.

review_title: Great Dog & Pony Show in Ethics Training Loses Great Employees
pros: Lots of smart, earnest employees on the front lines in terms of Patient Care Advocates, Client Services Specialists, Client Administrators and a variety of technical specialists.  The recruiters working to gather these folks do a great job.
cons: While Express Scripts puts on a fine show by way of its various mandatory intranet training sessions, upper management fails to follow through on these same moral precepts.  While the company hires great front line employees, upper management's behavior undermines the belief of these employees in its corporate culture.

review_title: Gained valuable skills to transition outside ESI-- My Job was Outsourced!
pros: good insurance benefits, coverage package
cons: Don't know where to start..  lack of communication between management and employees on important company changes, policies, additions of clients. Overworked, under paid, poor treatment of its employees. Expect to work overtime without much notice, wiggle room, or having a life outside work. Doesn't exist for front line employees which is sad. Difficult working conditions and overly stressful, which a job SHOULD NOT be.  Every raise, critism is based on "business needs" and the expectation to maintain employment without being penalized. Pharmacy as an organization/healthcare industry needs to be well organized with sound business practices. Client satisfaction is based on employee satisfaction.

review_title: Working at express scripts for over a year, legacy medco employee for 10 years
pros: Still have a job. Good 401k plan.
cons: Pay freeze.  Insurance premiums increased with higher deductible.  You are expected to output over 100 scripts an hour or be put on a probation program. Quality is suffering, which hurts the patients. Stress is very high.  Getting to the point where I don't want to go to work.  We also had a new hire group start with 20 people, we have 5 left that made it. I read that Express is planning on hiring 1,500 people for their St Louis plant. They better hire 5,000 people to start, maybe by the end of probation they will have the 1,500 people they claim to be looking to hire.  Be ready to work like crazy for a sub-par paycheck.

pros: Many of the employees are very friendly and polite.
cons: The company does not set high standards with regard to the level of experience, talents and competencies of their employees.  The focus is mainly on the bottom line and doing things as inexpensively as possible.  As a result, the service levels provided to clients and plan members is not as good as it should be.  There is so much bureaucracy at ESI- it is run very inefficiently.

pros: income and the many different jogoppurtunties
cons:
sometimes feel over whelmed by patients 
and the change in benefits for 2013.

pros: none none none none none none none none, none, none. Is that 20 words yet?
cons: supervisors are treated with absolutely no respect. Opinions are not valued. Salaried, so they can make you work as much as they want. No loyalty, will fire anyone at any time for any reason. It is ALWAYS a "putting out fires" mentality, so everyone is always stressed, and absolutely nobody likes the job. In the years of working there, never met a single person who said they like it there.

job_title: Director of Finance in Saint Louis, MO
pros: This company is incredible to work for. My finance team is one of the best. Everyone is friendly, trustworthy, and brilliant. The company moves very fast and is very rewarding. If you are a hard worker and build a brand for yourself, you can go very far here! The new CEO is incredible and the culture continues to get better and better.
cons: Not many cons, it is fast paced and hard work so if that type of atmosphere isn't for you then it will not be great. Longer hours are expected and there are not a lot of corporate sponsored happy hours / parties / events.

pros: Company is led by "lean" experts who specialized in making car parts.  Their lack of understanding of the healthcare have produced dangerous goals at the expense of quality.   Numbers management have fostered a culture of lack of respect for the individual.  Long term vision and goals are always secondary to short term metrics of "shrink" and "rates".  Rates are now points per day instead of rx's per hour.
cons: What's agreed upon in writing is never a guarantee.  Company is always trying to renegotiate contracts as it sees fit.  Always and always, it tries to gain the upper hand at the expense of the workers.  Threats and punishments are retaliations for not agreeing with the company's wishes.

pros: pay is decent, nice building to work in
cons: Middle management keeps pressing employees to work more and more hours, both in the office and out.  In addition, it seems that middle management is less and less educated about specific issues in their deparments.  They constantly consider every 'problem' a crisis and pull every fire alarm they can reach.   Then at the end of the year, you are judged by a panel of middle management to see how worthy you are of a year end bonus.  If one or more members of that panel doesn't like you personally, then you can kiss your bonus goodbye.

review_title: Happy employees are clearly not the priority
pros:
Major player in Healthcare
Many jobs allow telecommuting
cons:
Employees are over worked and under paid
The forced ranking system pits staff against one another and fosters extreme politics
Philosophy is to sugar coat issues and paint a rosy picture for Sr. Staff
Constant layoffs lead to a constant level of stress

job_title: Senior, Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great senior level leadership.  They know where they are taking the company and how they want to get there.  There is the ability to move across departments if you have the desire to have an impact in another area of the company.
cons: Healthcare management moves very fast.  The workload is heavy and expectations are high.  You will either love this environment or hate it.  The other challenge is the staffing philosophy.  A majority of jobs are being not only contracted, but shipped off shore.

review_title: I am embarrassed to tell people the name of the company I work for most of the time.
pros: I am hard pressed to find any.
cons: Patients should be the top priority. I have been watching Express Scripts since the Medco buy out was final two years ago. I hoped things would settle out and focus would be turned more toward the patient. But it has not happened. Time and time again things have happened to confirm my original assessment that money is the be all, do all, end al with Express Scripts. And patients and their needs are relegated to the back burner time and time again. Maybe because the CEO is a bean counter. I do know the way a company is run and the philosophy and policies of a company start at the top and the inside. They filter top down and inside out. So maybe it is the bean counter mentality. I am sorry that the patient is not first priority.

pros: Lots to learn, constantly challenging.
cons: With every reorganization staff just keeps getting cut, and cut and cut some more and then you are asked to cover even more when you are already working crazy hours.  Low concern for employees who are struggling to keep everything afloat for with long hours and low pay scale.

job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Saint Marys, GA
pros: Had income coming in, had opportunity to earn more income.
cons:
They make most other call centers seem like a piece of cake.  

Back to back to back to back calls, especially during day shift and peek times.  

Strict scripts to go by.  Almost every call is a bad call and most times you could tell it was Express Scripts fault.  

The company continued to raise standards that seemed almost unreachable.  

Not the job for parents who don't have a very good family plan in case your child gets sick.  They can care less.

I hear it has gotten better, but it is only from people within management.  I would need to get on Valium to go back to that job again.

pros:
- strong pay scale, bonus plan and equity.
- plenty of opportunity to grow, work and learn a wide variety of areas of the business.
cons:
- leadership (all levels: Dir, Sr Dir, to M1 VP, M2 VP to C-level) do not support change.  They are unwilling, incapable of having tough conversations with each other toward driving meaningful change for ESI's business.
- Sr leadership is unwilling to see thru the "spin" and "storytelling" that runs rampant.
- these leadership levels will and do "eat their own" in order to avoid accountability or hard conversations.  All under the message: Express Way values.
- the industry is about price: CVS and others win business based on price, period.  Leadership starting at the top continues to imagine that plan sponsors will pay for the "clinical" expertise.

review_title: All about the numbers in a lean environment
pros: Good work hours, good opportunities for improvement, good dress code, lots of celebrations of employee productivity every month.  Lots of cupcakes and pizza all the time.
cons: No personal growth unless you want to become a pharmacist manager or supervisor. Time off is generous if a slot is open on the week or day you desire. 401K is standard with a match from employer. Flex account third party requires additional documentation ALL the time.  Job is not for the faint of heart if you see a high turnover in pharmacy technicians and pharmacist supervisors ( who are techs too).

pros: I get a paycheck. I have benefits. I like most of the people I've worked with. Commute is good. Work from home sometimes is good.
cons: Senior management has no sense of what the right thing to do is. How can a company grow 'organically' when they don't know what quality customer service is?  They love creating layers and layers of red tape for the employees to wade through.

review_title: growing and changing the PBM industry
pros: ever changing reality  with the  Medco  merger going forward..   fast paced work environment.. great opportunities to lead people  and make a great impact on their world  .. so far many different sites to work at ..
cons: huge demands on management  and little recognition  because everyone is looking at  what the next hot topic may be.. account management  appears to be limited in where you are allowed to work from , and in how much they understand what goes on in the front line employees world  ( the people who really talk to their clients)   they are losing the expertise and knowledge of frontline employees by overlooking people in their contact centers

pros: Reasonable pay.  Nice facility.  Comfortable and ergonomic workstations.  The Tampa location in an old mall has convenient access to child care, food court, and fitness center.
cons:
The company let too much of the experienced management go.  Inexperienced supervisors are repeating mistakes that were tried years ago.
Morale is very low.
The Tampa site is controlled by power-hungry old women who do not seek input from their subject matter experts.  Decisions are made based on a whim or what will be best for them personally - with little concern about the impact on the business.

job_title: Senior Business Systems Analyst in Franklin Lakes, NJ
pros:
Flexibility is a great perk
Great PTO allowance
Good health benefits.
cons:
NO Work life Balance what so ever. Can not work in this role if you are starting a family. Burnout is inevitable. Most managers are young, really young and it is a clique. If your not in your ratings, raise, and bonus will suffer.
Process to interview for other departments is insane too.

job_title: Director, Service Delivery in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Great at strategic thinking, very innovative
Genuinely care about their patients, customers and clients
Genuinely care about providing the best products and services
Very focused on compliance
cons:
Not focused on employee engagement, very reactive vs. proactive when it comes to employee satisfaction
More focused on cost vs. quality; don't look at larger picture when making cost saving decisions
Not able to offer the same quality services for the same low price as competitors

job_title: Associate Business Analyst in Saint Louis, MO
pros: After I got home from my deployment, I came home to St. Louis to get my degree. After I graduated, I tried to find a job and Express Scripts was the first to offer me a job. They have paid me well and I've progressed within the company. Whenever I needed time off, I always received time off. Location is very close to my house so my commute is easy.
cons: Just like in the Navy, there are people who probably shouldn't be in leadership positions but, somehow find there way into those positions. This is common in today's America.

review_title: It is a brand "NEW" Express Scripts and Accredo...
pros:
1.  I feel like I am part Ida team and not just a number to the organization
2.  I know my opinion counts; might not always get implemented but people are listening
3.  The culture at Accredo is phenomenal - we love our new Ops VPGM.  We know her by name!
4.  You just feel like what we do matters and bring apart of ESI is rewarding!
5.  Started as a PCA and now I am in management position
cons:
1.  Benefits are high but better than nothing
2.  Would like on site child care

pros:
Work from home. 
They provide the equipment such as computer and phone.
Unlimited (for the most part) overtime.
Ability to accrue a lot of PTO.
Different insurance options with HRA, HSA and FSA.
Great trainers and supervisors. 
Weekly pay.
cons:
The training program is 8 weeks, which seems like a long time, but its not nearly enough for as  much information as you are expected to learn. 
The hourly pay should be higher for the amount of work that is required. This is probably the most stressful job I've had (but its still a good job, don't get me work) but one of the lowest paying jobs I've had.

pros: Working at Express Scripts has served me up opportunities to learn and lead in my field that I don't think I would have gotten in other companies in St. Louis.  Being one of the more successful large employers in the area, I think that sometimes the company is a target for bad press and people wait for bad things to happen.   I can definitely say that has not been my experience here!  My leadership team empowers me, and counts on me to get the job done.
cons: The company moves at a fast pace, if you don't want to learn and grow while pushing the business forward, this may not be the place for you.

pros: Clean work environment, had own desk, headset, phone, computer, etc., training provided, working hours were M-F, offered occaissional overtime but not mandatory
cons: Micro-managing was awful, not every team lead was on the same page due to lack of clear communication or lack of desire to follow the same procedures. Not much room to advance.

review_title: Not for those seeking a technical career
pros: The salaries are still competitive with the industry.  The benefits are decent.  There are opportunities for advancement into management for those so inclined.
cons: Management is short sited.  They are focused on quarterly Wall Street returns rather than long term stability and integrity.  Technicians are being phased out and offshored.  If you desire a technical career path, this is not the place for you.  It won't be long before ESI will have no inhouse technical expertise.

review_title: now i know i'm not crazy
pros: a job, time off accrues immediatly
cons: hmmm, let me see, employees compensated below market rates, promotions going to friends even if they are not qualified, people who try to do above and beyond are picked at by tech leads and if you report the harrassment you are marked for life.

pros:

I love the group of people that I work with
cons:
Pay 
Benefits
Management

review_title: GO SOME PLACE ELSE - DON'T WORK HERE
job_title: Call Center ASC in Bloomington, MN
pros: Benefits ok for some things, but salaries are terrible. raises are a disgrace 12 cents an hour,
cons: Are on you constantly to keep stats up.  Don't care if customers are satisified  with call.  Get alot of calls from senior citizens and they are constantly on you to cut them off and get onto another call. Do not have any empathy for their employees or their lives. Constantly tell employees they are the "most well paid call center" in other words don't expect a raise no matter how hard you work. Now they laid off all the pre-authorized department personel and are outsourceing that whole department.  Unemployment is so bad in Minnesota now they laid off all these people.  The almightly bottom line for their pockets.

pros: Bonus opportunity potential.  Decent benefits.
cons: No training.  Very little opportunity for advancement.  Job insecurity.   Poor work / life balance. While taking advantage of tax breaks to "create new jobs", it is laying off many Information Technology workers in St. Louis and Bloomington MN. The jobs are being outsourced to H1B visa workers who are taking our good paying American jobs off-shore. Mean while, George Paz (CEO of Express Scripts - see the name on this site's web page) just cashed in on another $43 million in stock options. This company could be the poster child for what is wrong with corporate America.

job_title: Senior Product Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: In past years you could cash in on 200% bonuses and double your projected bonus payout.  PTO was permitted with advanced notice.
cons: Advancement is based largely on who you know and are friends with.  It is not uncommon for qualified people get passed over for others having cozy relationships with senior managment.  Competency level of people with seniority is fairly low because those with talent typically move on after two years.  Excessive hours at the office or online is either expected or imitated.  Bonus payouts to contributors are at the whim of senior management.

review_title: Enter the Super Matrix! Process overload! Run from this place if you hate giving status!!!!!!
pros:
-there are some smart people who work there, who are open to new concepts and ways of working
-there are some easy to use tools, since they are huge microsoft users (i.e. sharepoint, infopath, project, etc)
-they have a really nice campus here in st louis, and a nice office space
cons:
-their matrix environment is overkill.  The org chart means almost nothing at times, because there are so many relationships to manage and maintain
-There are constantly PMs asking you for status to the point where you almost do not need to do your job, they will do it for you! lol!

review_title: They do not care for their employees
job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Saint Louis, MO
pros: They want to help the client at all costs
cons: Everyone makes $10 per hour and they will find anyway to not have to pay a decent raise.  Their employment practices are deplorable and reprehensible.  There is no respect for the workforce and therefore, they feel no loyalty and receive none from their employees.  Turnover is at an 85% rate and most barely make it out of the 4 weeks of training to work but one week on the floor and then leave; after discovering the working environment.

review_title: Not the best place to work...
pros:
-Benefits
-Wage (but this is not typical, I get paid more than other people in my department)
-My co-workers are like a second family
cons:
-Hours (too much overtime)
-Work life balance is horrible because of hours
-Lots of stress!!
-Leadership is questionable
-Hard to move up because there are SO many employees and lots of competition

pros: Got paid each week. ESI did a 401K match. Senior management in Nevada that had previously been with MedcoHealth were fair and caring.
cons: Constantly changing SOPs and those changes didn't make sense. Several incompetent supervisors that didn't care. My supervisor encouraged hiding the truth from members and others.  Little room for advancement.

job_title: Senior Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
•	Working in the corporate office for such a large company with so much influence over healthcare was challenging and rewarding. You definitely felt like you were working somewhere that could make a difference in people’s lives. 
•	My coworkers were very supportive and fun to work with. My department was small and everyone genuinely cared about each other. 
•	The culture of the entire company relaxed quite a bit in the time that I was there – for example, jeans every day. The benefits package was generous and the pay was very good.
cons:
•	Very hierarchical corporate environment. 
•	Since the company is so large, any changes or new ideas can take a very long time to come to fruition.

pros: Wish I could say decent pay
cons:
Directors can't direct
Managers can't manage
Supervisors are clueless
Team leads are want to be all of the above who are inexperienced, think they know it all and play a key part in keeping this company down.

Supervisors (BB) takes old processes that have been working fine and come up with horrible ideas that drag down a department (bulk an prep) and sends the ripple effect into the warehouse department that results in Mandatory overtime daily and on weekends. 

This place sucks! And the ideas of upper management suck along with it.

This place has no concern for work/life balance although that's what they preach. And now, if you have a scheduled PTO on a Monday for an extended weekend and Saturday is mandated you are required to work the Saturday or be punished. That's how the Warehouse works! 

Please stay away from this place!!!!!

review_title: As long as Wall Street is happy...
job_title: Senior Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Good pay and bonus, stock options and grants for mid-level and above. Decent PTO
cons:
Poor work-life balance in many areas, IT and operations especially.  Annual layoffs impacting many areas. I knew no one that was proud to say they worked for Express Scripts.  Company doesn't foster team environment.  Advancement is often based on appearances and not performance. 
Proven improvements to systems and processes are ignored with the fear of exposing other failures and incompetence. CEO often jokes about layoffs in quarterly employee meetings.

review_title: Help your patient's and employees before they all go to walmart
job_title: Manager Customer Service in Tempe, AZ
pros: There used to be a reason to work here to service the patients, those days are long gone.
cons: They push employees to meet numbers everyday. They don't care about customer service any longer. They are into consumerology, but to the employees it means servicing the patient's that built the company. They loose contracts every month due to less and less service. They bring in supervisors and managers rather than promoting from within. There is no longevity here because senior mangement drives everyone out. There is no respect for the staff that keeps the engine running.

review_title: Great if you don't want to be challenged or advance your career
job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Maryland Heights, MO
pros: PTO, Medical Benefits, People you work with
cons: Where do I start, management are nothing but a bunch of little dictators who have no regard for the fact that you have a life outside of work. Talking down and belittling is very common. Atmosphere is more like a sweatshop, or a stable full of horses. We are not people we are numbers that produce numbers. HR is worthless. The little people get along very well, but don't dare to have a better idea than your supervisor. The atmosphere is one of the most stressfull I've ever worked in. The pay is some of the worst in the industry, and if they could they would pay even less.

review_title: Great Company gone bad since merger with Medco.  Two totally different cultures conflicting in all departments.
pros: Great benefits in the workplace.  Good opportunity to lead projects and develop, fine tune skills while learning new ones.
cons: Lack of communication among management level and departments.  Directors scrambling to hold on to their jobs while not caring about their reports.  Work-life balance non existent unless you are willing to work 60 hours a week, every week.

review_title: Started at the Entry Level and Grew with the Company
job_title: Senior Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
- Opportunities for growth
- Feeling that I matter to the company and directly impact the business
- Working for an organization with a higher purpose than just profits, by making prescriptions safer and more affordable and caring for patients
- Great teamwork culture
- Very generous paid time off policies
- Strong leadership team
cons:
- The industry is very competitive and complex
- Takes a long time to learn PBM
- A lot is expected from everyone in the company which translates to long hours

job_title: Senior Scrum Master in Franklin Lakes, NJ
pros: Work life balance is top notch. Aces for work culture. Aces for SUPER diversity. At Express Scripts work is easy. Very easy to love what you do because leadership support is super amazing. As a matter of fact I can't express in words why I just love to go in to the office every day. Work from home is also very flexible.
cons: I am so comfortable at this job I honestly can't think of any cons. FYI Express Scripts is not what it used to be a few years ago. This company, now a subsidiary of Cigna, is truly one of the best places to work in America and there are statistics to prove that.

review_title: We have an open door policy... ask anytime. NOT!
job_title: Prescription Benefit Specialist in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Nice buildings. Safe from the outside world entering any buildings. Clean Parking lots. Great security guards. Great PTO Benefits and now the ability to use it. There are some great employees, but there are more lazy people that get promoted.
cons:
I repeatedly reported problems with the automatic refills or also known as Worry-Free Fills®. I sent more than 7 times. There were 10 examples each time. I was told by a team lead "That not our problem, they need to talk to customer service". Sad thing is that she was awarded employee of the quarter or year. 6 months later, when the MONEY for over an expected 254,000,000(Yes a quarter of a billion) automatic refills were never shipped.
   They said that it was fixed, but when I brought this up to the director of MCC. I was told that it was working as designed. They either need to train their employees on how to fix it or actually fix the system. 
**1** My first write up.  I asked to get some approved time off the phone to create a a very easy to understand document with screen shots. I was denied for more than a week. I had more that 10 examples of new orders that were being placed in the system that showed that they patient was setup for autoenrollment for WFF®, but if you checked the setup screen it showed that the autoenrollment was never selected, So after the first order shipped. I showed that the scripts were not enrolled in WFF®, so the first auto refill will never be delivered until they order it. It took me about 90 minutes to write the document up. I was written up for staying on the clock. Guilty I did
**2** I got an order that was being difficult on getting entered into the system. I asked for 2 days to get 10 minutes of time to enter the order. After the second day, which was going to impact the patients expectations. I stayed for 46 minutes to enter the 17 script order. Guilty
**3rd and final warning** My shift ended at 5:00 PM. I got a call at 4:58. They wrote me up for being on the clock after 5 PM. If I would have went into ACW, they could write me for for call abandonment.
***4th and final*** I had to call a patient back, due to his wife needing to provide the authorization to discuss her list of over 15 scripts openly with her husband. Our team uses Microsoft Offie communicator. I asked and advised that it would be a lengthy call. I was authorized to call them. At the end, the husband asked to speak to my supervisor to provide a compliment on how easy it was to change to the mail order. About 10 minutes later, I got a Kudos Email telling about how the service provided made them happy. A week later I got an email from my supervisor asking what were you doing in ACW(After Call Work) for 2 hours"? I advised that I couldn't remember. After 4 days. I asked if the team OC could be checked. The team leads will send you messages after 4 minutes of acw... there must have been something after 2 hours. The day before Thanks Giving, I was fired.

review_title: Votes 2nd worst company to work for in the U.S.
job_title: Data Entry Technician in Fairfield, OH
pros: There were no pros to this job.  When it was Medco it was slightly tolerable but Express Scripts "merged" with Medco and it became a nightmare. It really earned it's ranking as 2nd worst company to work for.
cons: Super micromanaged.  The management was lazy and incompetent.  They brought in more and more management.  I can't stress the absurdity enough, it was like Office Space.  I had 5 tiers of management in the building alone.  The people who actually do work are treated horribly.  Disrespect and threatened.  The pay is crap.  I was fed so many lies about raises and bonuses.  Never happened.  I was asked to come back.. I'd rather be homeless.

review_title: Nice company to get your foot in the door, not for growth
job_title: Software Developer in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Fair pay upon starting
Nice amount of PTO (might change in 2020 due to Cigna merger)
Opportunity for personal development
Work/Life balance
Flexible work hours
cons:
Slow promotion/career growth
Management seems to care more about delivery than empowering and developing their employees
Management wants to solve all of the problems themselves, rather than listening to those under them that are closer to the problem.
There has been a shift in culture since the Cigna merger, employees are simply "resources" now and are treated as such.
They have benefits, they just aren't very competitive.

pros: You learn a lot, of course through your own ability. You may get training, but its mostly a hands on job. They offer benefits and tuition reimbursement.
cons: Processes are terrible, and some just seem to be a waste of time. They expect workers to do more work and learn other processes with no additional pay. They expect more productivity out of workers with no incentive to do so, other than holding on to the position you have. The companies actions give employees the impression that they are expendable. I have seen lots of talent just leave, and they don't utilize the talent they have.

review_title: Ever decreasing benefits, zero loyalty, upper management treats people like they are stupid.
pros: Interesting equipment to work on, very clean environment, my direct supervisor and manager were very good. Pay and benefits are decent although over the past 3 years have continued to decrease.
cons: Vegas plant is closing so hundreds of people are going to be out of jobs very soon. Upper management seems absolutely clueless how to treat people. They constantly freeze pay, reduce pay for some and reduce benefits. There is zero communication and when they try to communicate its typically wrong...

pros: Pay is decent, there are a lot of smart people working for the company.  There are advancement opportunities for professional people at headquarters.  Can't speak first hand to operations/call center type jobs.
cons: Lack of focus from management, can't work on everything at once.  The ends justify the means.  Ends = quarterly numbers.  Means = whatever it takes to hit them.

job_title: Contract Specialist in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Pays well, but that is about it.
cons: As another reviewer pointed out, take a look at how many positive reviews have recently been posted by current employees.  Senior management is encouraging these positive reviews because they know the reputation the company has as a horrible place to work.  I was there for 6 years and I ask myself all the time why I stayed so long.  So many of the recent reviews describe the company as "fast paced" - that's not quite an accurate description.  I have always worked hard and have always had extremely good reviews, just as I did at ESI.  But the simple fact is they care only about money.  Employees are so overworked and under appreciated.  There is no work life balance, and the culture is so negative because everyone is overworked and stressed out.  You either become a part of it or you leave it.

job_title: Senior Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Good bonus potential 
Generous Personal Time off
Lots of internal opportunities
Aggressive performance review/calibration to weed out non-performers
Diversity - mainly women >50%, but no international diversity
Work from home option
Top management is very down to earth and accessible
Many employee discounts
Don't believe all the sour reviews by former Medco people
cons:
If you are below manager level - it is a sweat shop.  Limited training opportunities for professional advancement.  Company is cheap when it comes to investing for the long term especially IT reources.  IT solutions are half baked and always need a bandaid.  Most operations departments run a shadow IT organization by hiring their own IT people to make ends meet as IT department is very difficult to work with.  

 No long term thinking/goals by upper management, after August everyone is only concerned about 1/1.  Forced ranking (GE style) of bottom 10% eats away any team work or morale - no reason to cooperate or not play politics with co workers.  Only way to get Stretch performance ranking is if you do not have family and willing to put in 80 hours a week all year, not uncommon to see divorce rates peaking after major integrations.  It gets crazy during holidays  before 1/1.  

ESI was the only game in town during recession, so it could afford to pay only 70-80% market rate of base salary.  But with no bonus in 2012 and employment picture better in St. Louis, attrition will eat away the talent.  
Expect to see mass layoffs at all levels after the Medco integration is completed in early 2014 to compensate for loss of UHC account and to achieve promised synergy savings to Wall Street.  Also the end of patent cliff savings does not bode well for 2014.  Health Care Reform might save the day.  

ESI will dominate the PBM industry in the future like Walmart, but like Walmart it may not be the best place for everyone.  The dependence on government programs will increase - DOD, Medicare and Health Care Reform.  Company management will complain about Obama and government but without the government programs, ESI will be less than half its current size.

review_title: Data Entry Tech at Express Scripts
pros: Good benefits, somewhat friendly employees, and Monday through Friday shift
cons: Inconsistant management and HR department. Don't every mention something to your supervisor about improving work flow that they see as negative, it will come up in your review. HR does nothing but side with management when they know clearly they are wrong in certain situations. Supervisors say and do what they want to a tech because they have the power to do so. I've been with the company for over five years on the healthbridge side of ESI and tried to move forward hundreds of times, but I'm still stuck in this position.

review_title: It is just a job, not a career
pros: No nights, limited weekends, no holidays.
cons: No confidence in upper level management, very poor communication, management has not earned my respect.  Accomplishment based solely on rate of order processing. Doesn't matter if you do a good job or a poor job, the faster you turn an order over (albeit correct or still having errors), as long as you can turn over orders quickly, you get brownie points.  Pharmacists are not respected for their roles and abilities.  I feel like I am being used rather than utilized.

pros: Good pay, double time and a half during high volume, good benefits, great management-employee relationship. I had no problem communicating with my supervisor, trainer, manager, human resources, etc. Cafeteria had Starbucks coffee, opportunity for advancement. My schedule was perfect, 11AM-8:30PM M-F, paid holidays. You had to choose what you wanted your schedule to be, greatest to least. People who had worked there longer had first choices.
cons: When I worked there, they changed it to where you were either on calls for most or half the shift, or on faxes. I was easily bored as I was assigned to be on calls most of my shifts unless my supervisor allowed me to switch to faxes. Call volume was low a lot of the time.

pros: Good salary; most managers understand work/life balance; ability to work from home occasionally
cons: Departments are understaffed and lack proper resources. Senior leadership has talked much in the past year about improving employee morale and encouraging internal growth ... but they never follow through on these initiatives. The end result: Everyone is forced to do more with less, and morale continues to weaken.

pros: Good work for people who love to problem solve.  In my experience it was a friendly environment with every call being a different challenge.
cons: One of the most stressful jobs I have ever had. Management lies about promotion opportunities and turnaround time is very high.  Was told by multiple supervisors that asking for a raise is not allowed (you only get one of your supervisor likes you).  Impossible to provide actual customer service because company is obsessed with call time and expects you to sacrifice service to patients. No incentive to improve skills and stats

job_title: Program Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Good Benefits in relations to other organizations
Location next to University of Missouri campus
Pay rate above average
cons:
Territorial management--very silo based
Unscrupulous business practices in some areas of the organization
Employee recognition is non-existent below the Director level
Downward communication slow or missing altogether; some managers are much better than others in this respect

pros: Pay put in place by Medco with backing of union,Medco union contract with raises,bonuses,and ample time off.  Job was good before merger with esi.
cons: Everything esi. HORRIBLE management by the esi team. Realigned shifts with no regard to people's family lives. No compassion. Unreachable goals set to push employees to complete 100+ Rxs an hr with less than 3 errors a week, 8-10 hrs a day 5 days a week extremely unhappy employees . Miserable work environment. Only reason to stay is its hard to find jobs in this economy, anti anxiety meds to get you thru work week . Would not recommend this place to my worst enemy.

review_title: Without a doubt the most demanding, stressful job I had.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: It's a big company, and allows you to make a lot of contacts. There is so much demanded of you, it makes any other job/company seem easy.
cons: Employees are spread way too thin.  Each employee is doing the job of AT LEAST two people.  There is no room for mistakes.  If you make one mistake you are singled out and written up.  They preach work/life balance but they demand so much of your time that when you spend time with family (vacation, etc.) you are spending days to catch up.

review_title: A small piece of your soul will die everyday
pros: Absolutely nothing. They dont even supply paper cups for coffee in ST. Louis.
cons: Everything is a challenge. Work/life balance, pay, zero cooperation between departments, health benefits atrocious, Senior management, HR ... The list goes on and on. I'm shocked this organization makes a profit with so much disfunction. Don't be fooled by phony HR postings ... They run this organization and will run it into the ground. Promotions are non-existent. Medco employees, those few that are left, are treated like dogs.

review_title: From a former Express Scripts - former Medco employee
job_title: Client Service Specialist in Dallas, TX
pros: Provides a paycheck and benefits
cons: Worked for Medco for 5 years; ESI for 2 years, in two years I lost over $10,000 a year in bonuses; Lost working for a company which was customer service driven to one which is bottom line compulsive. Lost empowerment with performing my job with the dedication and integrity which is important to me to one who micromanages; stats are the rule of the day; not customer satisfaction. Went from an environment with opportunity and stability to chaos, discontent and toxic environment. Then they closed and laid off everyone at the Medco site which I was working.

review_title: Numbers Driven- Limited Focus on satisfaction
job_title: Training Specialist in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great Benefits and generous time off that was accrued if you've been with the company a whole. the option for work at home was also nice.
cons: As compared to the predicessor Medco, ESI is too focused on reaching their target number and some many other things fade away such as quality of service to the clients- over the years they have lost some big name clients so i am unsure where the future of the company will lead.

pros: Most co-workers are awesome. Work at home is a nice opportunity, but need to ensure those who have it use the privilege responsibility.
cons: Management! They simply do not listen. If an honest concern is voiced (co-worker cheating the time clock) you are looked at as a complainer. The facts are not checked, even though there is documentation.  Favoritism is a real problem.  Truth is not supported, they only want to hear good things, even when negative things are very real. Even with documentation!

review_title: You don't want to work there
pros: It's close to home, and they do allow you to flex your schedule for appointments
cons: They only care about making the Pharmacists happy.  Upper management take the time to come on the floor and speak with and interact with the Pharmacists.  They set out rate/hour unrealistically high to acheive and expect zero errors to be made, then berate you if you make errors or cannot acheive the high rate.  The pay is low for your knowledge and they treat non pharmacist as "monkeys" that are incapable of having any intelligence or knowledge at all, even though there are many non pharmacist employees degrees, licenses, and certifications.

review_title: I did not witness professionalism from HR leadership - they cast a long shadow of meaness into the organziation.
pros: Financially, well managed company.  People really care about the patients and wish to do well on behalf of the patients.
cons: Leadership motivated by greed and power - especially HR.  A bit sad. Deserved sweat shop reputation.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Las Vegas, NV
pros: The company offers excellent benefits and generous time according to the length of employment.
cons: Numbers driven where across all departments you are require to submit your "numbers" that is used to determine business needs and jobs. Previously was hired under Medco where the focus was Training and Quality to improve Patient experience, ESI is far from that concept and the number of what you've done is more important than the quality of work. The pay was ok but not compensated as well as the former company Medco.

pros: benefits, PTO (if you allowed to take the days requested)
cons: Management seems to be using "the book of failed management": heavy reliance on metrics (that are made up to have something to tabulate but are irrelevant to actual job), blame vs coaching (tho they have started using that moniker), keep employees isolated (as opposed to encouraging team-playing & problem solving), punish employees for questions about "opportunities" or for bringing "challenges" (& solutions) to light, organizational charts do not reflect chain of command (supervisors ignorant of subordinates responsibilities, could not take over for the employee, but full of negative feedback).

review_title: No direction for senior leadership, unrealistic expectations, and don't bother unless you want to live in St Louis.
pros: None. Working for this company was horrible.
cons: Every day hung over the employees the possibility of layoffs...if you worked anywhere other than in St Louis. Direction is supposed to trickle down, giving employees no view into the big picture of their responsibilities...resulting in shoddy Frankenstein-like solutions. The timelines on projects are nothing short of ridiculous, and the attitude is to get things implemented and worry about whether it runs or is correct later. One day, there will be major compliance implications. Oh, and "pharmacy that goes farther" is the most horrible grammatical error in a slogan I have ever heard. It makes me embarrassed to have worked there.

pros: Benefits are good, health, paid time off,401k with company match
cons: Management is horrible they are unwilling to help they act like they care but don't. There are guidelines in place that are almost impossible to meet if you care about the patient.  This company doesn't care anything about the patient all they care about is the money. If you are someone who genuinely care about  patients and want to help this is not the job for you.

job_title: Senior Manager in Jersey City, NJ
pros: Decent benefits, including paid time off accrual
cons: The CEO needs a semester at charm school - he's a stumbling, ad libbing mess in front of his employees. And he's unable to handle a merger - if this co. ever purchases yours, run away. Performance reviews are an absolute joke - just a tick mark on a manager's checklist, yet the CEO insists it sorts the good from the bad. And communication with employees is simply awful; they distribute plenty of slogans, apparent pats on the back, and glossy web pages with smiling faces; but real info is never disseminated in any formal way. What Fortune 25 company loses top execs after less than a year - and never announce it internally!

pros:
Health Benefits
401K
PTO
Some Work At Home Available (ESI is trying to kill this though)
cons:
You will never feel secure with their bi-yearly layoffs and this will only get worse because CVS / Caremark has pretty much stolen every major client that went out for bid since the merger. 

They outsource everything they can to India and the Philippines because paying American workers would take too much away from the companies bottom line and we all know management isn't going to be outsourced.  

Raises for regular non-union employees were often under 1.5% with inflation as high as 3.8% during my tenure and this hasn't changed.  At $20 an hour that's a 30 cent raise at best when in 2008 inflation would have eaten up 76 cents of that $20.  1.5% was during the good years, it was actually closer to 1% during the 2008 years and it didn't get much better for people exceeding expectations.  

Union busting at pretty much every level, how else will they pay CSRs 50% less money and get them to settle for 25 cents as an annual raise?

HR and the STD / LTD handlers denying claims for people with potentially life threatening disorders.

Managers that don't do their job and instead plead ignorance when an employee is caught doing something they witnessed first hand.  If more than one employee is fired for doing something wrong under the same manager, it is time to get rid of that manager.

Some managers would force sick people to come into work and then head for the amusement park for half the day on the company dime.

Employees being promoted for being a relative or friend of a member of management.

Air Quality issues in some buildings (My site of less than a thousand people had no less than 6 cases of pneumonia at the same time, can you say legionnaires disease?)

Medco's customer order-management program was frequently broken and is now the basis for the new express-scripts systems, which is a step backwards. ESI systems were old but, functional.

Compensation was based on favoritism and not the value you brought to the team and these were used to limit what jobs you could be considered for.

review_title: I wish they treated employees better.
pros: Ability to telecommute. Good compensation/bonuses.  Loved the people I worked with they understood what working as a team meant.
cons: The management team did not make the work at home employees feel like the were a vibrant part of the overall team.  Really let team know what is going on with profitably.  Really work on career pathing with employees.

pros:
This is healthcare company that really focuses on their mission of providing affordable medicines and maximum care to the patients....through the process, you have an opportunity to make great contributions.  I really love this industry.  To me it's important to believe in the product the company I work for is trying to produce or support; and I truly respect the work that Express Scripts does. 

Great place to work in terms of flexibility in some positions. Great benefits. Pay is competitive. 

Challenging environment....

I've had great leaders......
cons:
If you are not great at adapting to change, you will not succeed. 

If you you are not interested in working hard, not the place for you.

pros: flexible schedule!! low stress (this is mail order pharmacy).  I worked four 10 hour shifts m-thur and had 3 day weekends!!! I got to do a lot of things that I had missed working every other weekend at Walgreens. Its a good job if you have young children and need a flexible schedule.  Its also nice because you actually get to eat lunch!
cons: redundant, don't feel like i'm truely using my pharmacist education sitting in a cubicle checking RX's. I do the same thing 10 hours a day.  My wrist started hurting from clicking the mouse so much

review_title: Great place to work, as long as you aren't union.
job_title: Customer Service Representative in Harrisburg, PA
pros: Express Scripts pays its employees well and gives them good health benefits.  They talk a lot about mutual respect and fairness as well as honesty and integrity and I think that for the most part, they live up to these things.
cons: Express Scripts does nothing to ensure that its union sites recieve the same types of benefits that its non-union sites receive.  Union sites recieve none of the bonus packages that other sites recieve unless the WHOLE site achieves the bonus.  Harrisburg union site does not offer benefits to domestic partners as ESI does and employee morale at the union sites are very very low.

review_title: Express Scripts provides the illusion of a great working environment
job_title: Senior IT Manager in Bloomington, MN
pros: Fast pasted, every changing environment with some innovative thinking at all levels.  There are pockets of management that truely show concern for their employees, encouraging people to be passionate about their work.  To some degree, there is still a small company atmosphere that make people feel that their work is important
cons: Management tends to treat employee's as a dispossible asset but tries to hide it with illusions of employee satisfaction surveys, actions, etc. Also does not promote within very much and most positions above manager is only available to the St Louis area.

job_title: Customer Support Specialist in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Flexible work environment, numerous work at home positions available, casual dress code,  fair bonus program, can carry a good portion of Paid Time Off balance forward each calendar year, career growth opportunities exist if you are a stellar employee. Very professional team members. I benefit greatly from the college compensation program which is offered to all full time employees.
cons: Would like to see a bit more diversity in the work place. Work life balance a bit difficult because high weekly work hours are the set expectation of most employees. Customer service reps's could use more training and orientation. Expect that you learn the job very quickly. Would like to see more training programs.

job_title: Prior Authorization Supervisor in Tampa, FL
pros: Great pay, outstanding senior leadership (Director & Senior Manager), fabulous colleagues (fellow Supervisors).  Pretty good severance packages.
cons: Hired 120 temp employees off the street and expected them to produce at a high level.  Senior upper management foreseen great business only to lay off the entire department in less than 6 months.  Went live on 01/05/2015 and was completely eliminated by mid February 2015.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst in Saint Louis, MO
pros: It was a safe place to work, air conditioned, heated.
cons: Unless you interned there while you were in college  forget about moving up. Multiple departments all doing the same projects at the same time. My Director worked 7 days a weeks 10-12 hours a day (I am not exaggerating ) because she refused to delegate anything.

job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Saint Marys, GA
pros: Paid 8 weeks 8-10 weeks of training. Bonus received at the end of the month (last pay check) depending on how well your BOT & OPI score. BOT=retail to mail, sending fax requests to doctor offices, submitting renewal requests for Rx's. OPI=good attendance, on time for/from breaks and lunch, etc.
cons: After January of each year the company seemingly finds a way to fire people or give out write ups. You learn absolutely nothing in training. They base everything on "integrity" which the Supervisors, Managers, and upper management is lacking. Program system is outdated.

review_title: All about revenue, don't care about the people
job_title: Senior Manager in Franklin Lakes, NJ
pros: Most locations allow one day work from home.
cons: Only care about the bottom line, which means low salaries, lots of contractors (that don't become FTE's) and frequent layoffs.  It is a frequent occurance to have a (big) layoff and then due to too much trimming, a year or two later bringing back some formerly laid off ee's at a super reduction in salary.  So if you stay at ESI for any length of time, do well and are rewarded for it - you could easily become a target for the next round of layoffs.

pros: Free parking and full cafeteria in the building.
cons: Everything else.  From benefits to compensation to communication, it is the worst.

job_title: Account Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: I met some great people
cons: There is no work life balance

job_title: Systems Engineer in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Pay is competitive, physical work environment is nice. Legacy ESI employees are both knowledgeable & friendly to work with.
cons:
Been in the IT business for 30+ years, worked for other Fortune 50 companies and NEVER witnessed a Sr Mgmt group more in over their heads. With Sr & Exec Mgmt, "The Express Way" is simply a slogan. The "worker bees" practice the philosophy because it's basically mutual respect for fellow employees. Mgmt levels don't even begin to deploy "The Express Way" concepts.

Legacy Medco employees make it clear that those of us in the Midwest are simply just a bunch of "country Bumpkins" who have no idea what we're doing. Mgmt is not only aware of this attitude, they have witnessed it 1st hand, but refuse to correct it. Very disconnetced Mgmt from the Director level and up.

job_title: Specialty Distibution in Lake Mary, FL
pros: Great benefits is all that keeps most people there. Pto is as most places 20 days off per year goes up after 5 yrs
cons: No input from employees is taken into consideration. . Managers are always right. HR always side with management. Working there seems like modern day slavery with a pay check. If management messes up they get to take management classes to better their skills... as many times as needed. If an employee messes up you're fired...no warning!

job_title: Resolution Team Lead in Dublin, OH
pros:
Benefits when it was Medco-outstanding 
Hours were great
Management when it was Medco  was fabulous
cons:
no communication once merger began
crazy hours
Confusion between departments and responsibilities 
CEO has no value other than money driven
ESI reps extremely rude and unprofessional, it's no wonder they wanted Medco quality but can't seem to get there

job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Saint Marys, GA
pros: If you're seeking experience in a call center, this company will provide enough that you can take those skills to another, better company.
cons: No room for advancement. Minimal pay for maximum work. No raises. They will train you to handle multiple clients and use various software, adding to your work load, but don't expect to be compensated for the addition work you're taking on. Company claims to provide opportunities for advancement, but will in fact hire from outside for most positions. No balance between work and personal life.

pros: Express scripts work at home program was great in the past with ability to set your own schedule and work. The goals were a pretty high.
cons: Very high goals and constant pressure are issues with express scripts. Often times the management is insensitive to the concerns of the pharmacy staff. There is a very high turnover in management staff. Layoffs every few years.

job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Bloomington, MN
pros: Great for becoming aware of health care issues, like HIPAA and privacy, or being aware that some times medicine essential for allergic reactions or mental health stability and how to handle those issues.
cons: Tracking can be an issue for mailed orders during busy seasons.  Dealing with upset customers who did not know that their prescription insurance has limits at the local pharmacy so they have to start mail orders to get the medicine covered by insurance after 3 fills or when the medicine needs additional information to be approved for a Prior Authorization to fill, having to explain the process.  I do think having it not be a well known type of service has made customers more annoyed when they call.

review_title: Probably one of the most demoralizing companies I've had the unfortunate pleasure to work for.
job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Tempe, AZ
pros: When my shift has ended and it's time for me to go home.
cons: Managers,supervisors,and surprisingly co-workers have a tendency talk to you in a perfunctory manner. It's a cultural which based on meanness, and callousness. And, it's exceedingly rare to find people smiling let alone in good-mood. The lack of leadership skills in  management is largely to blame for the despondent, yet stressful work environment. For example, when system is not functioning properly management has a devil-may-care attitude and advise us to do the best with what is operating at the time. Also, when speaking to the patient, brevity is key otherwise you'll be placed on a corrective action plan for talking too long.

review_title: Not the best culture, limited growth
job_title: Sales Coordinator in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The building/cafeteria are very nice and pleasant to work in, the people can be kind and the PTO is generous- 20 days total. The work from home policy is also great
cons: Very strict hierarchy- your perceived worth is determined by your title. There are strict rules stating that you can't even apply for a new position without your manager's approval, and this limits upward growth. It seems like people's actions are motived by the desire to move to the next step on the corporate ladder, not by what is actually the best choice for patients and the company. Too many people with management titles that create unneeded processes.

review_title: worst company i have EVER worked for in the many years that i have been working.....if you are thinking of applying.run
job_title: Customer Service Representative in North Versailles, PA
pros: other than in the general area of where i live, nothing.......medco employees are the best thing this comany has going for them.....
cons: trying to run a pharmacy like an assembly line does not cut it..these are people's lives we are dealing about. they do not care about the customers, just meeting numbers, that's all that is important to them....loosing experienced and talented employees daily who ethically can not work like this......would never recommend this company to anyone!!!! horrible

review_title: More like an institution than a pharmacy
pros: The employees care about the customer. There are opportunities to advance although it is likely to be temporary.
cons: Management cares only about their metrics and they drive employees to the breaking point to get the numbers they want while making the work environment hostile and uncomfortable. The typical supervisor has no people skills; they are just a willing, warm body.  There is no benefit to longevity with this company. Use it as a stepping stone and move on.

pros:
Pay seems above average for the area.  
Medical benefits have tanked recently (high premiums, high deductible, etc)
Dental and vision benefits are great
Retirement benefits are outstanding (1-1 match for first 6% in 401K, 100% vested immediately)
5% discount on company stocks
Yearly bonuses are significant and vary depending on pay grade (low level employees don't get any)
Parking is secure and abundant
Easily accessed via I-70
cons:
Tuition reimbursement hasn't increased in 4 years ($5500 a year)
Need more emphasis on career development
A lot of people complain of over work.  You will work hard, and at the minimum, the full 40 hours a week 
Recent inclusion of excessive contract workers has led to a lack of expert knowledge in the IT department

review_title: All they care about is profit! Not the employees and not the patients!
pros: Good salary, only because I was a part of the company they bought out though.
cons: This company is getting too big for their own good, the use the cheapest operating systems that do not provide the information needed to complete your jobs the most efficiently! To much room for error using multiple systems to get all the information needed. Profit is their bottom line and senior management will do whatever they need to to get ahead. They don't care about employees AT ALL!

review_title: Merger EE pains linger, need to be more thoughtful towards EEs
pros: Compensation was competitive.  Work at home is great.
cons:
