The company is trying to figure out how to work together as a merged organization since acquiring Medco.  Due to the high # of layoffs, the workload increased.  Working hard is not the issue, it's trying to navigate and find people in departments to assist in client issues.  In my role I rarely dealt with mail order or member issues.  As a result of all the downsizing, I found myself focused on these items and was left with less time to grow my business and service my clients.  I was became a highly paid CSR.

I took pride in my work and worked hard, I averaged 55 hours a week.  It was frustrating that others did not seem to have the same pride, I think so many just became numb as things started to go downhill.  

Long term clients were feeling surprised at all the issues that began to arise and continued.  New clients felt as if they were sold something but the company did not live up to what sales had promised.

I decided to leave the organization when I realized my reputation was being tarnished by things I could not control.  Company reductions and lack of thoughtful SOPs made it difficult to do my job.

job_title: Patient Care Coordinator in Byfield, MA
pros: The job can be very rewarding if you can get past the constant micromanagement and attitude. It is very unfortunate that it is all about numbers and not about the patients.
cons: Where should I start? Pay... Horrible! You can work at a fast food restaurant get paid more and treated better! Management preaches communication... there is none! Management literally begs for overtime because everyone is quitting. It is like working in a sweatshop.

review_title: "Just say no" when it comes to working here
job_title: Credit and Collections Analyst in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The company is very competative in regards to compensation.
cons: This company is a good example of a badly run organization. Express-Scripts process' are manual at best. This company grew too fast and has very little internal communicating programs. No communication from management or training. They pop you in a chair, thow a bunch of files at y ou and tell you to "run with it". And you better not make a mistake in the process.  High volume of work leaves you juggling a work load and being reprimanded for not completing everything perfectly.  If someone tells you about a open position here, run don't walk.

review_title: Company Built on Dissatisfied and Ineffectual  Staff
pros:
-Very Casual Environment
-Flexible schedule
-Seen minimal improvement in the last 2 months
cons:
-Lack of leadership
-Extremely high turn over
-Menial compensation
-Few Check and Balances

pros: I would assume for most, any job in the medical field would be ideal. My experience-or rating, is a Major D+  with a minor in disapointment.
cons: The training was absolutely disorganized and inadequate (also assuming, you have been at a real professional Co). The enviroment is that of "Highschool" students failing English and manners 101. There are incentives yes, but what you are paid and the atmosphere presented...just does not make up for working for a system that is already broken.

pros: Work at home is possible, moving around the company is possible, lots of people who work there truly care about clients and members
cons: Long hours, senior management does not value knowledge and experience, the non-compete that many employees have to sign is very restrictive.  Going in first as a contracted employee may be a good idea, so that you know what you are getting before becoming an ESI employee and having to        sign the non compete agreement.

job_title: PCA and RTL in Las Vegas, NV
pros: The pay is relatively good and you learn useful information about how the prescription insurance world operates.
cons: Express Scripts is the dollar store of the PBM industry and they treat their employees no better than their members and clients. They do NOT emphasize customer service rater making the call quick. You will get marked down more on a call by upsetting the member then you would giving inaccurate information. So it is advantageous to lie to a member so they don't get mad. I was originally trained by Medco Health before the merger, and couldn't stomach Express Scripts' lack of ethics.

review_title: glad i left when i did
pros: Met some nice people that are now friends
cons: never enough work to stay a full shift. Pressure to make impossible numbers per hour with no mistakes. Ad always moving you to different departments to learn something new. Watched themhire new groups (20 or 30 at a time) and not certified techs. I spent alot of money to become certified and spent 6 years in retail before being hired with this company. Raises took forever to get and were only pennies. Terrible experience other thn the new friends i made.

pros: Good pharmacists, good computer systems, nice facility, well lit work stations, ample parking, adequate personal time policies, casual dress policy
cons: Managers are pharmacists and not professional management, too many department leads, auditors, and white board owners wasting time and corporate dollars.

job_title: Project Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Tim Wentworth seems to be a decent guy; he gives me hope. The salary is decent and bonuses are good if you qualify for them.
cons: Everything else about this company is pretty bad. They continue to downsize departments, requiring the next one up to take on the work of the previous department, with MINIMAL training. Clients are gong to start seeing serious issues with their service because so many areas are suffering from lack of knowledge and support.

review_title: Not worth long term career goals
job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Tempe, AZ
pros: Flexibility,  they try to work with you on your schedule and home life.  Nice cafeteria with a grill and a cook with fresh food.
cons: Everything else about this company is so out dated.  They want to bring in new talent so badly but they should start with making their current employees feel appreciated.   I didn't get a master's degree to be stuck on the phone because my supervisor wanted to keep a high ranking employee and not let us get promoted or advance in the company.  You want slaves that day yes sir and yes ma'am.. if you're desperate for a job you don't need any experience,  they'll hire you.

review_title: Was a great opportunity before the acquisition.  Not enough experience to determine the future.
pros: Good benefits, casual work environment.  Excellent team based atmosphere.  Great coworkers and was an overall pleasant atmosphere.  Now there is a sense of impending doom, and everything is a secret. The employees are being told nothing about the future plans Express Scripts has for the Fairfield work force.
cons: Very strict conditions.  High and overall unrealistic performance expectations, leaving an employee to feel they are not and cannot make the grade.

review_title: Not the old Medco culture; now high pay to overcompensate for employee burnout and client / management distrust
job_title: Senior Manager in Franklin Lakes, NJ
pros: Clients appreciate the work that I specifically deliver.  My coworkers are good people who I enjoy.  I am given some freedom for project work such as procedure documentation.  I am trusted for my hours, schedule, and work ethic.  I am paid a competitive salary and bonus, and there is a clear, fair tracking of salaries to industry and company means and ranges.  There is flexibility with start and end time to allow for making an appointment or coordinating child pickup without needing to take paid time off and without impact to performance review.
cons: I am continuously given more work than a person in my position should be able to handle or prioritize along with aggressive timelines, high efficiency expectations, marginal staffing, and the very highest quality expectations - and there is little room to negotiate without a huge negative impact to performance review.  There hasn't been a slow week since April 2, 2012, the date of the merger with Medco.  My hard work is not appreciated or valued as it should be, but there is instead a lip service provided by others who are also not feeling appreciated but doing their best to survive.  As a employee, I am not trusted for content of projects such as training lists, training schedules, on boarding, vendor management, and asking other departments for support or input on a project within the other department's roles and responsibilities - I must go through management in most cases.  As a manager, my input for documentation of capacity and staffing is not valued.  Clients do not trust my company, so in turn my management and new client contacts do not trust the timeliness or quality of work of me, my employees and my contract workers.  No time or allowance mentor within the company within a different department - again, would require management approval from my management and from the management of the mentor - who would deem us too busy and would deem this a low priority.

job_title: Prior Authorization in Saint Louis, MO
pros: the penalty for leaving early,401k plan company match dollar for dollar,benefits
cons: management in CRD department is horrible, incomplete evaluations no explanations for raises they just give you whatever, rotating shifts every four to five months, if your hired into the CRD department no advancement . I left a job I was working for  two year to only be looking for new employment only a year later after being hired . I was placed into he worst department of the whole company. the other department are way better managed and it worth applying for but if you see prior authorization don't do it you'll be very upset

pros: A lot of hours and decent pay if you have been their long enough. They do excel at working with an employees personal and work schedule and if you do your job the supervisors pretty much leave you alone. The productivity tracker can stress a tech out to keep up with the required order movement if you aren't fast.
cons: Completely unprofessional environment. Married supervisors having relations with employees that they have under them and within their own department. Upward movement based on "high-school mentality" of helping your friends to move up even if they are less qualified than another.

review_title: Run to the exit - do not walk!
job_title: Senior Software Engineer in Saint Louis, MO
pros: I can't think of enough good things to merit a 20 word minimum. Checks never bounced. Earned time off was pretty good.
cons: Couldn't take the time off that I earned. No work - life balance. Disjointed, paranoid management structure. I worked in St. Louis, reported to a manager in New Jersey, who reported to a director in St. Louis, who reported to a VP in New Jersey. A near total lack of meaningful communication. No sense of history or continuity. So many layoffs and job cuts that temp HR people were the norm to handle layoffs.

review_title: Where You'll Find Opportunities to Learn, Grow & Lead
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Franklin Lakes, NJ
pros: This company has experienced much change over the years and although that may have caused unease and imbalance it has endured and  continues to strive for the best no matter what name it carries.   Employees care to care as we all depend on each other to come together when servicing our clients.   And those who can relate to the purpose and benefits ESI brings will naturally find opportunities here to learn, grow and lead.
cons: Express Scripts has hit some bumps in its pass that has caused organizational changes and, unfortunately, lay-offs.

review_title: Fast paced but politics got in the way
pros: Company is led by very talented individuals.  Benefits are great.
cons: Work environment has turned into the old boys network.  Careers for most do not exist.  It is just a job.  ESI has also moved many jobs to contractors or off-shore.

pros: Paid time off, pay is good but could be better
cons: Work life balance is not great, unreasonable expectations, not enough appreciation by management, yearly review process is cutthroat, low morale,

job_title: Senior Account Manager in Schnecksville, PA
pros: If you're accustomed to working in fast-paced environments where deadlines are a priority and handling multiple responsibilities simultaneously are the norm, then Express Scripts is the job for you. If you thrive on the challenge to meet and exceed goals and are able to hit the ground running with little supervision, Express Scripts is the job for you.
cons: A career with Express Scripts is wonderful.  The bar is set extremely high and takes a minimum of 2 years just to feel comfortable with your current role and responsibilities. The healthcare industry is so complex that there's so much that you need to know and absorb.

pros:
•	Casual work environment
•	Work from home
cons:
•	Constantly restructuring departments and not properly utilizing peoples skillsets
o	It is impossible to fit a square peg in a round hole
•	Constantly changing software and not working out discrepancies before launch (new software would miss important attributes of the old)
•	Work load is unmanageable
•	No work life balance (60-70 hours/week)
•	Reward is non-existent for putting work before your family
•	Management had no transparency
•	No mutual respect

job_title: IT Senior Director Austin in Austin, TX
pros:
Not sure if it’s startegically great idea to have ITDirector / ITSenior Director /IT Vice President. 
Is Director are so inefficient that they Senior Director to watch them and is Senior Director are not doing their job that they need Vice President to watch . 
From Director level To Vice President level what is the job difference amongst them . They are just doing copy paste of their responsibility and taking more pay checks .

The CIO should merge these 3 roles into one  and save money and let the Director be efficient enough and do the work .

You need one Director to manage 5 manager ,.for what ? Are the resources so unskilled and unethical ? 

It’s time for senior executive to THINk .
cons: All Director / Senior Director are covering each other backs to keep the pay check running .

pros: Good people to work with.  Decent healthcare benefits and 401k match.
cons: Huge pressure to keep headcount down.  Too much work put on everybody's plate.  Management can be good, but am often deal with just as much as a crappy hand as their employees.

review_title: Cold, numbers-oriented workplace and too much politics
job_title: Senior Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Bonus system, competitive salary, growing company
cons: Broken performance management structure, too much reliance on politics in choosing promotions, cold approach to its employees, pays lips service to work/life balance but treats its workers like cattle, unfriendly environment where people are always looking over their shoulders

pros: guaranteed 40 hours, mostly nice co workers, scheduled breaks, overtime allotted, sometimes they even gave extra $ incentives for working overtime (other than time and a half), paid weekly.
cons: supervisors only care about themselves, the caller could be dead wrong and they take customer satisfaction to a wrong level, don't care about their employees, cant even be two seconds late, they forget to factor in the fact that were humans and we have lives too.

job_title: Patient Care Advocate II in Warrendale, PA
pros: Great organization, wonderful leadership and training. Pharmacists were excellent in handling urgent needs of callers. Benefits began after 30 days and were industry standard. PTO system was great, you were able to select hours and were able to see what was available, without checking with a supervisor.
cons: Did not like the hours. I worked the later shift & the other departments - billing/ insurance were not open for business. I was not able to immediately provide an answer or transfer the patient to that department.

pros: Pay is good, PTO available immediately however can not request a week or more for any planned vacation, only one day at a time approved, may never get whole time requested.
cons: Sitting literally all shift, health issues start from constant position, esp. spine, headaches, weight gain, slowed metabolism, severe eye strain from 8+ hrs a day using computer, you must be devoid of morals to lie to patients for the sake of a contract, life and death medications should not be a commodity for shareholders, loss of any skills previously learned, you read off a screen all hours, no deviation allowed, sometimes it is the same paragraph approx 5-10 mins over and over again all shift, your value is determined in seconds, how fast you talk, get patient off phone, time between hangups and being ready for next call, not helping patients .

review_title: Not a person, just a number.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Castle, DE
pros: A few good hard working people who care.  The pharmacists are great what they do. People do have good intentions, but the outcome is minimal.
cons: VERY few members on the leadership team who show any type of setting a good example.  This creates a lazy, foul mouthed environment-which breeds negativity. The pay isn’t great by any means. Even when you think you do a perfect job, the difference in pay compared to fat lazy slob is tiny.

job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Saint Marys, GA
pros: Steady hours, pay for performance, good wages, clean environment, and I liked helping patients understand their benefits and assist them with their pharmaceutical needs.  The computer system was well laid out.
cons: Not allowed to read during extreme down time, even during holidays when you get maybe 8 calls, the coworkers are very touchy, but feel the need to discuss personal issues during breaks and be treated with sugar coated sympathy when asking an opinion.  They do overall changes of hours that is based on time there not performance.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Harrisburg, PA
pros: The salary was decent and the other employees in my department were great to work with.  The hours were good and the team leads were helpful when needed.
cons: There are too many management possitions for the amount of employees.  It is a union shop but the union doesn't stand behind the employees at all.  If the company doesn't want to keep paying long term employees their salaries they just get rid of the department you work in but in a way that keeps you from getting a severence package.

review_title: Corporate ways will drive this company into the ground.
pros: Solid company, room to grow if you like corporate stuff.
cons: Weak management. Both managers I had were incredibly weak. Ask questions, first one would simply write back a crappy email, asking me what the answer was, since she didn't know. Act like she was training me by making me go find answers.  But she got promoted. 2nd manager was so scared he would whisper on the phone, since he didn't want to have anyone at corporate hear him. Again, could not answer questions, umm, let me get back to you that, then never would. Again, he was promoted as well.

review_title: A great company to work for to jumpstart your career
job_title: Software Engineer, Intern in Orlando, FL
pros: I've had the opportunity to acquire a summer internship at Express Scrips for the technology team and was welcomed with open arms.  Being fully engaged, welcoming challenges and felt apart of the bigger picture is what it's all about.
cons: I think one downhill thing to consider is to remind other coworkers that communication / body language is important.  There were times where your questions weren't valuable or if it was being overlooked. Sometimes it didn't mean harm but it was overbearing / stressful at times to withstand on weekly basis.

review_title: Is the juice worth the squeeze?
job_title: Project Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Valuable learning experience regarding the industry, co-workers were great people.
cons: Although the company is experiencing tremendous growth, the corporate culture is all about squeezing every ounce of work out of their employees.   As new employees have been brought on through acquisition management is letting numerous individuals go while telling existing workers there are very limited resources.  Complete disregard for work/life balance and management seems to show little to no concern with the high rate of turn over that exists.

pros:
The company is great to work for. The call centers, granted attendance is vital for call centers, are so poorly managed its ridiculous. You can't ask your manager for a day off because he/she will have to ask ALL the other managers ENTERPRISE WIDE, if you can have that day off. If you have a family, definitely stay away from the call centers. They pay well, but the restrictions and policies are so stringent, its almost impossible to get time off.

Pay
Cafeteria is pretty good
cons:
Flexibility
Management of individual departments
Attendance policy seriously needs to be based off of reality, and not what 2 people in a department of 60, think is "good."

job_title: Project Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Great working environment within your team! Nice facility. Decent benefits. Umm... There's a cafeteria. Some really nice people. Free parking.
cons: Lack of transparency between employees and upper management. Could be let go at anytime. Internal structure needs a lot of work. Lots of money wasted on needless things. Good ideas often fall on deaf ears. "Yes" men seem to succeed the most.

pros: Good, smart people, trying to focus on patient care and improving member service and satisfaction.  The company is working to develop a long term strategy.
cons: Constantly changing priorities, changing management, inconsistent treatment of employees, poor environment, stressful, and poor work life balance.  Hoping new management at the top will start to change the corporate culture.  No value given for talent and expertise, but rather focus on the lowest cost alternative for most jobs.

job_title: Senior Director in Franklin Lakes, NJ
pros: ESI has a lot of the support and structure valued in a large company.  Including an adequate benefit package, decent career pathing. ESI is highly ethical and supports a strong diverse work environment.
cons: ESI appears to be chasing success so much so that priorities and goals change extremely quickly. This erratic environment has led to continuous reorg, staff realignment, and reductions. Therefore the company has a poor morale and lack of stability feel.

job_title: Project Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
- WHEN they give out bonuses they tend to be pretty good
- Nice facilities (which is good because you pretty much live there!)
- State of the art pharmacy
cons:
- Lack of advancement opportunities
- NO work/life balance
- Obscene turnover rate
- Very cliquish environment
- They don't get rid of directors based on performance, they tend to just move them from one department to another...

review_title: The patients are running the asylum!
job_title: Client Service in Franklin Lakes, NJ
pros: WFH option in some business units, decent pay and benefits. That's all, folks!
cons: The merger has ruined this place. Pure h#*! on earth. If you are a postive person with a good outlook on life then I suggest you RUN far, far away. ESI will destroy your soul and age you very quickly. I've witnessed people literally crying at their desks (NJ offices). NO support from management, VERY long hours, unrealistic expectations, very high turnover, discriminatory practices, unethical behavior, alot of fishy things done behind the scenes, etc....If you want a good picture of what life is like at Express Scripts, I suggest you watch the film "Misery". Imagine you (potential EE) are the author, Paul Sheldon and Express Scripts is Kathy Bates. Like I said, RUN!

pros: Company stability for the next few years
cons: Merger poorly planned for transitioning sites.  Lack of support for transitioned functions leading to increase in inefficiency and general frustration of techs left to flounder in the deep end.  Supervisors clueless on the details of processes they supervise, left to pick at numbers and metrics for which they have no way of feasibly understanding.  Toxic work environment with less focus on cooperative effort and more on selfish self-promoting.

review_title: if you are ok with brown nosing this is the place for you.
job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Orlando, FL
pros: benefits are great, i pay next to nothing for my prescriptions and my medical visits are zero copay required. they are the best next to tricare insurance
cons: they play favorites and do not pay you for the extra work they require you to do. they are more focus on what their image looks like that actually taking care of their employees. never seen so many supervisors more interested in gossiping than actually doing their jobs.

pros:
Great people who are committed to an important mission
Competitive compensation and benefits
Culture change is real as company moves to its next stage after a long history of successful M&A driven growth
cons:
Can be a very fast moving culture (not a con for those for whom it is the right fit)
Healthcare focus means many jobs can require availability after normal hours, holidays
Aligning all leaders to and defining the culture required for organic growth is still a work in progress, so some employee experience may be inconsistent

job_title: Customer Care Representative in Tempe, AZ
pros: Plenty of work, some decent benefits, pay was better than average
cons: Even though the training program was quite extensive (6 weeks) classroom. I learned more in the 2 weeks on the floor actually doing the job. Knowledge without application is useless. I found it amazing that a company this large did not have a training simulator program that would mirror actual and most common questions encountered in a call center.

review_title: Sucked the life out of me.
pros: PTO time, but you are required to stay on top of things while you were off so it really wasn't time off. Nice building and covered parking.
cons: The GE forced performance is a joke at ESI. You are worked to the bone doing your regular job and then expected to do extra work not included in your daily job. It's all about your IPS. Your are then evaluated by senior management, most who are long term employees and take care of their friends. Someone has to end up on the bottom of the grid. Hard work does not matter at ESI. It's about relationships with upper management.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Too soon to really tell, but so far it seems that they are focused on their employees. They are also focused on driving the business forward. It is also beneficial to be non-union if employed by express scripts.
cons: I will know more once the benefits package is rolled out, but so far it appears as though the new vacation and bonus structures are going to be less than what they were with Medco. I can only hope that the medical benefits will get better with a larger field of employees

review_title: Who is going to start the class action lawsuit?
pros: There are no longer any pros to work at this company.
cons: Express Scripts was lost when they merged with Medco and migrated clients to antiquated systems and processes.  Clients were told the platform change would be seamless - very little change.  This was an outright deception.  Valuable, high performing people have quit.

job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Bloomington, MN
pros: When you have time in between calls you can read or do other activities. The pay is decent. You learn a lot about insurance claims and Privacy law.
cons: Make sure you're on your toes because they will try to nickel and dime your paycheck. Your questions and concerned will be advised but not managed or answered. The expectations are so high for what you don't get paid. They are very disorganized with feedback floating in on random. The personal time is not enough when you have to walk to the bathroom. You will not to be happy here. I can guarantee it.

review_title: Dynamic company focused on the bottom line
pros: Great teammates who are extremely supportive.  Good benefits.  Always new challenges and opportunities to succeed.  Every day brings something new that will keep you occupied.
cons: Poor work life balance.  Senior leadership is focused on the bottom line, not the whole package of what it takes to make a business successful.  On one side they talk about improving the quality of work-life, but then they add additional demands on everyone.

job_title: Senior Product Manager in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
The people here are very passionate about what they do and you rarely come across someone who isn't willing to pitch in. I regularly use the company awards points recognition process to recognize my colleagues for their extraordinary work and collaboration. I have use award points that I've earned to order great things out of the company catalog...kade spade bags, hotel stays, a tablet..There is no lack of recognition for a job well done here and the mobility is endless. 
My leadership team has been very supportive of me advancing my career and has even given me assignments that I can use to speak to during an interview where I'm lacking in experience. The great thing about working for a big company like this is that you don't have to leave the company and its great benefits when you are ready for a change. You can stay right here! 
Our CEO, George Paz, is as real as it gets. I love when he talks to us at management meetings; you feel like you are talking to an old friend, and he's been known to make some pretty funny off the cuff remarks.
cons:
I've heard that your experience depends on your leadership team. If you work for a leader that doesn't have a great sense of work/life balance or micromanages, then you are going to have a terrible experience.....but isn't that anywhere? 
The environment gets more intense the closer you are to patient care. In the PBM world, everything happens and point of sale. If something goes wrong, a member might not get their medication and that is when stuff gets real around here. It is all hands on deck, but there is always much celebration with your team after you pull through a crisis!

pros:
Pay- the only thing that keeps people at this company for as long as they an stomach it.
(However, most people come to realize they would work for a better company for less money)
cons: Management (all levels) is incompetent, unfair, deceptive, ineffective, and lazy bullies.  Management also walks around with their head down, looking at their shoes instead of greeting the employees.  All the employees, including management, are robotic.  The company has mission statements that no one follows, especially not management.   This is a sad show of what corporate America is today.  The company cares about its profit margins, not the customers nor the employees who actually do some work.

review_title: Noble Mission, Strong leadership, empowered team
pros: Making healthcare accessible and affordable is something that I'm excited to get out of bed for in the morning!  I've had the fortune to work for a few great organizations, but I've never seen passionate senior leadership like this - absolutely driven by the Mission.  It is also exciting to see people so empowered in their roles; every one of us is enabled to make a difference!
cons: With empowerment comes responsibility.  I enjoy the high-responsibility and high-accountability environment, but it can be intimidating at first.  Once you see your own results, though, it is very engaging!

pros: Work from home option,holidays. Good job to get your feet wet to learn about coporate politics. Learned alot about politics.
cons: Do not hire per their own job description, micromanagement, do not value hard working employees who have proven results, do not value education or experience. If you are the type who does not know anyone or socialize outside of work with their peers you will not go far.

review_title: Clearly focused on the bottom line, with little concern for employees
job_title: Data Entry Pharmacy Technician in Albuquerque, NM
pros: Best benefits I have had up to this point in my career
cons:
The site I worked at (Albuquerque) didn't seem to have any internal succession planning for the site director position. They went through several in the 3 years I was a tech there. 

I attempted to transfer to St Louis when I had to move and did not get the impression that they valued keeping/ cross training somebody who already knew their systems.

review_title: Lumbering giant has unrealistic expectations and discourages teamwork.
pros:
Good amount of 'vacation time', if you are allowed to take it. 
Nice work environment at headquarters.
Starbucks and cafeteria on site.
cons:
Company is very slow to respond.  IT is very slow.  IT service tickets have taken as long as 45 days to complete.
At least 10 people are CC'd on every email when subject probably only applies to a few. 
Collaboration with coworkers is discouraged.
Unrealistic expectations.
Meetings, meetings, meetings, and more meetings.
Management won't give guidance about what they want.  
Need to learn to read minds.  
A lot of talking negatively about people behind their backs. 
Complaining about people not showing up during snow storms or when sick then the next day talking about how they understand the need to stay home.  Which is it?

review_title: Very scary.  There is little teamwork, and they are always looking for whom to blame.
job_title: Account Management in Saint Louis, MO
pros: They pay well, but you earn it.  The cafeteria on site is nice too, and you are close to Ferguson if you want to go out.
cons: The culture is such that new ideas are frowned upon.  If something goes wrong, they are always looking to blame someone, so you are always worried about getting stabbed in the back.  I was in meetings all day, then read e-mail on my laptop at night until I fell asleep.

review_title: The best thing I did was Leave
pros: I managed a great team of people and created innovative products.  Benefits and salary were reasonable, twenty six days of paid time off
cons: First I needed to rank people who performed above my expectations as threshold employees, and then I watched my peers and managers re -rank those people so that employees in St Louis were ranked higher than others.

pros: Great people to work for. Being a senior employee the vacation time is great!
cons: To much micro managing. Health Benefits are not very good. Pay isn't very good for the job you do. Management wants to do more for less and the stress level is very high. Poor Communication between the different departments.

pros: Benefits, people working along side. cafeteria.
cons: pay relativly low. Benefits have been cut back a bit, but still pretty generous.

pros: Excellent benefits, and overtime opportunities
cons:
The training is awful. They train you for five weeks and they don’t do any continuous training. The pharmacy world there’s always changes, and they send out an email letting us know about the change but they never give us time or opportunities to read those emails. They expect us to know everything that is sent us but they don’t ever give us time to go over ask questions.
 Mandatory increase in responsibilities without added pay

review_title: Fair employer, but needs to make changes
job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Saint Louis, MO
pros: The benefits are good and working conditions are good.
cons: Employee suggestions and questions are brushed aside. There is a big turnover in new employees because of the difficulty of the job, and management is not doing a good job of making corrections or additions to the software we use to do our job.

pros:
Nice facilities
Decent salary
Fortune 500 company
Challenging work
Need a paycheck.  Always job opening because the turnover is so high.
cons:
No direction.
An atomosphere of complete mistrust.
Everyone is out for themselves.  Very little collegiality or teamwork.
So much turnover a lot of time is wasted due to knowledge loss and have to go around in circles and numerous departments to find out basic information.

pros: Standard benefits, can minimally flex hours (work a Saturday) if need to, 401K match
cons: I had a phone job/ all calls were listened to and evaluated/ there was constant coaching or negativity about calls and micromanagement to follow a script even as a professional. We were evaluated on quota and output, rather than quality. If you fell below their high quota, you heard about it. Equipment was constantly crashing or failing, but we were expected to keep up the same high numbers. Customer service seemed to be non-existent in most cases that I transferred to CS for help. When Express Scripts took over Medco they cut bonuses to all employees in my dept. and that was equivalent to a large pay cut. Only a very few top people now receive a small bonus, the rest get nothing. Their hourly pay is way below other jobs in my field, and they clock every minute you are on the computer. If their equipment fails or there is an internet outage, they expect people to make up the time on their own if they work at home. Not enough pd time off for the pressure of the job. Substandard health insurance at a tiered cost: if you make more, you pay substantially more for it.

job_title: Senior Director in Franklin Lakes, NJ
pros: Great group of people to work with in NJ.  Flexibility since much of management is constantly on the road.
cons: Focus is in St Louis, No loyalty to company by most employees.  Rough organization to respect.  People in NJ just waiting for the next wave of severance notices.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst in Saint Louis, MO
pros:
Benefits are average or above
Time off earned is pretty good (getting to actually use that time off is difficult)
cons:
Forced employee ranking is a morale killer
Work life balance is nonexistent for most areas
Continuing education is only available to a few (contrary to what is said)
Our team remained loyal long past when we should have run screaming
Outsourcing and offshoring is hemorrhaging essential knowledge
There is only lip service given to their 'core' values

review_title: The  brave new  ESI ( aka MEDCO really took over ?)
pros: enjoy working with the adults in my site, whether hourly or salaried  ...the work life  balance  is getting better somewhat.  the MORALE is finally being paid attention to     ..at legacy  ESI sites we are are open to changes for the better .. not sure about the other side ...after  10  years  almost  happy with my  pay  and  quite happy with my time off accrual rate ..  great stock  plan and 401K  .. and even with the thing i have concerns about ...  not even remotely ready to leave the company...  i want to stick around and  see what happens ..we continue to change and evolve  and i want to see what the 'finished' product is in say about  2016
cons: Extreme LACK OF COMMUNICATION  So  what really happened.is what i would like to know ..  we were told  we bought Medco.. then  the packaging  pretty much said  we merged with them.. now it feels nothing like that  ..  but more of a takeover ... thought we  as a company were  taking the best of both sides... but i don't see that .. just feels like we are becoming Medco... and  frankly   Medco  didn't handle things well enough to continue on their own which is why we paid cash for them right? .. so  give  legacy West some love and attention and look at  some of our best practices   rather than go  arrogantly through the day and think  you  don't have to implement some changes   or  how about basically appreciating that  we saved your a$$ets from  bankruptcy; oh and  only  legacy Medco people  seem to be being  promoted  up at this time ... all the  new  names and faces are not coming from the  legacy ESI side .. for example my Sr Director just stopped coming to work .. now  we have a new  interim one  who is legacy MEDCO.. maybe she is going to  get to know our ESI side of things  but I'm not  as hopeful as i used to be  about that

job_title: Lead Pharmacy Technician CphT in Tempe, AZ
pros: Flexible schedules and great supervisors. I started as a data entry tech and left as a  lead. There is a good amount of organization and for the most part everyone was helpful to others
cons: A lot of movement because of the Medco merger but even that wasnt a con and I am guessing probably no longer a problem. Promotions do not go to the most deserving and some supervisors play favorites of those that are not deserving.

review_title: Great place to work! Great benefits & a rewarding job for those of us that truly enjoy making a difference
job_title: Senior Patient Care Advocate in Tempe, AZ
pros: Great benefits, approachable & caring management,  opportunies for advancement & work @ home opportunities!
cons: I honestly can't think of any aspects of the job that  were problematic enough to need mentioned as cons. I mean, about the only thing i can come up with if i HAD to put something down is just that i wish there had been the option of an hour long lunch break since 30 minute breaks go by so quickly. Sorry... thats all I got (lol).

job_title: Patient Care Advocate in Tempe, AZ
pros: Pay is good and they have a GREAT 401K program (You can begin contributing immediately and are fully vested on day one. Also, if you are on the DOD contract, contributions are made to offset health care benefits difference.)
cons: Incoming callers can be rude and belligerent. Management does not always offer effective support. Employees are sometimes coerced to take on additional skills and duties with no financial reward.

job_title: Senior Director in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Challenging work and fast paced.  Opportunities to learn every day
cons: Extremely high expectations of all at all times; can be exhausting and stressful; a culture of "what have you done for me lately"

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Louis, MO
pros: Lots of opportunity to take on new challenges and gain varied experience within your function. Regardless of age or tenure if you're willing to put in the work your successes are recognized and directly impact your career trajectory. Changing culture (transparency from management,  casual work environment-jeans), work with the best-talented people, work that makes an impact.
cons: Lacking a clear stance on ability to work from home on a set schedule, for example a set day each week. Very limited maternity benefit (and you must exhaust your PTO first) and no paternity benefit; however continue to offer other new benefits.
